title: 2 dead, 3 injured in early morning shooting
content:
MILWAUKEE —
Two people were killed in a shooting at about 1 a.m. near 37th and Nash streets, the Milwaukee County Medical Examiner's Office said.
Milwaukee police said officers were called to the scene just before 1 a.m. Lt. Mark Stanmeyer said a known suspect shot five people during a family dispute."
I just heard about 17, 21 gunshots," said neighbor CeCe Childs
Two Milwaukee men, ages 25 and 26, died at the scene. Three other men, ages 25, 26, and 33, were injured and taken to a local hospital.
Police said there has been a spike in homicides this year. Malcom Hunt of Pastors United said the violence must stop.
"We are killing one another," he said. "Until we start to address what we are doing to one another, this is going to keep on going."
Stanmeyer said officers are searching for the shooter. Hunt said clergy in the city are working with community leaders to stop the violence.
